intro: Thymelaea, commonly known as mountain thyme or rock thyme, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. Thymelaea species are often found in arid or rocky environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They have simple, often linear leaves and produce fruits that are capsules containing numerous tiny seeds. The genus includes around 40 species, many of which are native to Africa, southern Europe, and western Asia.
